item.title: North American borehole temperature profiles for climate studies V1.0 (2016)
Northern Hemisphere hydroclimatic variability Database V1.0.0 (2016)
Australasian Low-resolution palaeoclimate records of the Common Era V1.0 (2017)
item.description: Australasian Low-resolution palaeoclimate records of the Common Era V1.0 (2017) # Current version:1.0.0 Access publication   Access database (NOAA) Citation details Bronwyn C. Dixon, Jonathan J. Tyler, Andrew M. Lorrey, Ian D. Goodwin, Joëlle Gergis, and Russell N. Drysdale. 2017. Low-Resolution Australasian Palaeoclimate Records of the Last 2000 Years. Climate of the Past, 13, 1403-1433. doi: 10.5194/cp-13-1403-2017 Summary of database: # This database is a compilation of low-resolution ( greater than annual resolution) paleoclimate records from the Australasian region over the Common Era (0-2000AD).

item.title: Australasian Temperature Reconstructions 1000-2000AD V.1.1.1 (2016)
item.description: Australasian Temperature Reconstructions Spanning the Last Millennium (2016) # Current version: V2.0 Access publication   Access data (NOAA) Citation details Joelle Gergis, Raphael Neukom, Ailie J.E. Gallant, and David J. Karoly. 2016. Australasian temperature reconstructions spanning the last millennium. Journal of Climate, 29(15), 5365-5392. doi: 10.1175/JCLI-D-13-00781.1 Summary of Reconstruction: # This study presents temperature reconstructions for the Australasia region, for the warm season (September to February) over 1000-2000AD.

item.title: Australian Multi-century cool- and warm season rainfall reconstructions (2017)
item.description: Australian Multi-century cool- and warm season rainfall reconstructions (2017) # Current version: V3.0 Access publication   Access data (Figshare) Citation details Freund, M., Henley, B. J., Karoly, D. J., Allen, K. J., and Baker, P. J.: Multi-century cool- and warm-season rainfall reconstructions for Australia’s major climatic regions, Clim. Past, 13, 1751–1770, https://doi.org/10.5194/cp-13-1751-2017, 2017 Summary of Reconstruction: # This study reconstructed Australian cool (April-September) and warm (October-March) season rainfall over 1200-1600CE, using an extensive network of palaeoclimate proxies from the Southern Hemisphere.

item.title: Ocean2K High-resolution 400year Coral Data and Tropical SST reconstructions (2015) V1.0
item.description: Ocean2K High-resolution 400year Coral Data and Tropical SST reconstructions (2015) V1.0 # Current Version: 1.0 Access publication   Access data (NOAA) Citation Details Tierney, J.E., Abram, N.J., Anchukaitis, K.J., Evans, M.N., Giry, C., Kilbourne, K.H., Saenger, C.P., Wu, H.C. and Zinke, J., 2015. Tropical sea surface temperatures for the past four centuries reconstructed from coral archives. paleoceanography, 30(3), pp.226-252. Summary of Database # This database presents four 400-year long annually resolved sea surface temperature reconstructions for four basins in the tropics - the Eastern Pacific, the Indian Ocean, the Western Atlantic Ocean, and the Western Pacific.
